titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 254: Teseide

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 254: Teseide are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: Various smudges and stains. A few folios trimmed close to the text. First and last folios show evidence of conservation repairs. In some places the rebinding has virtually eliminated the gutter.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Manuscript of the Teseide of Boccaccio. First three folios missing. This manuscript lacks the first 20 verses and ends with verse 83 of book xii, followed by a somewhat later inscription indicating ownership of "Bartolomeo & Tomaso Cholnj[?] Chessetto [or Chessello]" and an inscription on the verso of the last leaf. The text belongs to the B group of manuscripts (cf. Salvatore Battaglia's critical edition, Florence, 1938).

supportDesc.extent: 66 leaves : 295 x 212 (249 x 190) mm. bound to 303 x 223 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, iv + 66 + iv; 4-23, [24-29], 30-69; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 38-40 lines; ruled in lead.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by two different hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red used on some earlier pages for headings and highlights, with 2 red initials (f. 4v, 5r).

binding.p: Full brown Niger; bound by R. R. Donnelley, 1953.

origin.p: Written in Italy[?], probably during the 15th century (notes of Thomas R. Adams, on file in the Library). Zacour-Hirsch suggests late 14th century.

history.provenance: Bartolomeo and Tomaso Cholnj[?] Chessetto [or Chessello] (inscription, f. 69r).
